data.text: @DSchrippe @ASEANNOWTH Yeah, just count all the maniacs over the last 2 years 🙃

@DSchrippe @ASEANNOWTH Asymptomatic just means you carry one of the other hundreds or thousands of viruses with you all the time. It changes every year. Corona is part of regular flu waves, and every year they need a new vaccine. For what if your immune system is intact?

@Open_Media @ASEANNOWTH Asymptomatic means you have it and can infect others who might not be asymptomatic later on. I understand your point, for me it's a question about altruism or the new Me-first mentality.

@DSchrippe @ASEANNOWTH So your point is? You simply need to live with it. I understand that people feeling sick stay at home for their own sake but give me a break. Asymptomatic? That means healthy. Why the heck would you lock yourself up unless you are a completely manipulated scared sheep.
@Open_Media @ASEANNOWTH Yes, I have. It was not given up, it didn't work regardless of the fact that a lot didn't survived it. The issue is that the person who had it can get it again.
@ASEANNOWTH This guy don't give effective medicine for care at home!
@DSchrippe @ASEANNOWTH Ever heard of herd immunity? It is an older concept, was given up about 2 years ago 🕵️‍♂️. Anyways, Omicron fixes all of this now.

@Open_Media @ASEANNOWTH To infect others. 
The doctor is right, better stay at home instead of blocking hospitals beds. Yes, I know - keeping asymptomatic patients is like money printing.
